name: TownePlace Suites Raleigh Cary/Weston Parkway

reviews.text: I'm pretty easy on hotels when travelling on business, but this one gave me pause. It wasn't nearly as clean as I expect from a Marriott chain hotel. Glasses pulled from the cubbard were streaked with some sort of residue. The bathroom wasn't as clean as I expected. The desk had a large ring of residue from a large drink on it. Clearly, the wipedown normally performed during a changeout never occured. On multiple occassions during my stay, there was a strong cigarette odor, probably from a neighbor ignoring the no smoking signs. The property is maintained decently, but is not modern. For those who must have a pitch black room to sleep, the curtains do not totally black out the room, so the parking lamps gave a permanent glow indoors.
reviews.title: Ok at best

reviews.text: On the plus side, the rooms have a small kitchen. The property is about 1.5 miles from the Black Creek Greenway, which provides paved a trail system for walking, running, and biking. The hotel is less than 15 minutes from the airport.
reviews.title: Maybe it was the holiday weekend, but...

reviews.text: There were quite a few iffy characters hanging around. The room was clean. Bedding seemed new and comparable to other TownPlace Suites, however everything else needed updating. The halls and stairway had an old moldy smell. I’ve had better breakfast at other TownPlace Suites too. Maybe I’m just spoiled. Maybe it was the holiday weekend, but I doubt I or my family will return.
reviews.title: Paper thin walls, but clean

reviews.text: Nice hotel, very clean. My room was set up oddly. The TV didn't face the bed. The kitchenette was nice, although I didn't use it. My toilet kept running every 20 minutes and since I didn't arrive until after 5pm there was no maintenance staff still at work to repair it. They offered to move me, but I stayed put and just closed the bathroom door, so I wouldn't have to hear it. Not a big deal, just a small annoyance. The reason I wouldn't stay here again is because the walls are paper thin. I could clearly hear the conversation in the room next to me and they were not talking loud. I was not even in a connecting room. I value quiet time on business trips and this is a deal-breaker for me.
reviews.title: Quiet Location

reviews.text: My fiancee and I stayed here for three nights over Thanksgiving. There are two separate buildings separated by the parking lot. The main building has the breakfast area, front desk, workout room, breakfast area and ice machine. So if you want to use any of these and are in the other building you have to go out and walk outside to get to them. We had a studio room which had a queen bed, a sitting area, a kitchenette and the bathroom. The room was clean but the TV was awkward on this table and you had to try and swivel it to watch TV in bed. My Mom and Uncle stayed in a two room suite which had separate bedrooms, living room, kitchenette but shared one bath. But each bedroom had it's own TV as well as one in the living room. Great set up for a family. Both kitchens had a small full oven with 4 burners as well as a nice refrigerator. Dishes and a few pots and pans were provided and there was a dishwasher too. My only complaint on my room was there only one mirror in the bathroom. The bathroom was all inclusive (toilet, shower and sink) so there was no place for me to do my hair (dryer mounted on bathroom wall) and makeup while my boyfriend took his shower. I was lucky and was able to run next door to my Mom's room. They had mirrors in each of their bedrooms besides the bathroom mirror. The breakfast area was another story. It was SO SMALL. There were only 3 tables with one connected bench seat on one side and one chair opposite the table. The selections were good (cereal, break, juices, coffee, hard boil egg and oatmeal) but the room was so small and congested we ate there only once and decided to go out and eat on the other mornings. Very disappointing. There are no restaurants within walking distance so a car is a must -- then it is a short drive to several restaurants, fast food and grocery stores. Pets are allowed but I think they charge a fee.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

reviews.text: I could be wrong, but, it appears that Marriotts manager may be committing credit card fraud. I arrived and my credit card was charged for 6 nights, not a problem. After 6 nights my card was charged.
reviews.title: Marriott Town Place in Cary Must Fire Kevin Taylor (Manager) ASAP!

reviews.text: On the 7th night my card had over $1050 in credit card holds, by the 8th morning I saw another $1197 in credit card charges.. keep in mind I only owed $104 and they had $1050 of my money on hold. All in all Kevin charged my credit card over $2800 for a $100 charge?
reviews.title: Awful Service! Could care-less about the Customer.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we talked he was horrible, unprofessional and told me to pay more money or leave? Wow! Keep in mind, they have over $1000 of my money on hold.
reviews.title: Outstanding deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This situation it too bad since Dale (Assistant manager), Nadia (Desk manager) and the cleaning staff were excellent. The room was nice and excellent service.
reviews.title: very good breakfast

reviews.text: I'm traveling around the world and was excited to stay loyal to Marriot, but, now I'm scared that Marriott may steal my money. I just can't recommend this hotel unless credit card theft is apart of their service. Marriott just lost $30,000 of my business over the next year.
reviews.title: Good if you get it at the right price.

reviews.text: Its by no means fantastic, but a good place for a short stay. I stayed for a few days in TownePlace in September in a double room with a colleague. The double room consists of two bedrooms with a small living room, kitchenette and shared bathroom. The kitchenette has all the basic facilities well supplied with utensils and cutlery.
reviews.title: Decent place to stay

reviews.text: I agree with the reviews that the property seems a little old (old fashioned as well) but its clean and well maintained. In short, I would recommend this place for people who are looking for a simple place without frills.
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN

reviews.text: If there are any improvements to be suggested I would say that a double room should have at least two LAN cables. Managing with one is a little difficult. Also, an LCD/LED TV would be desirable in today's time (To be fair, the front desk did say that they are going to bring these changes by next year).
reviews.title: Fun location for business or pleasure; great staff service

reviews.text: This place looks nice in the pictures, but I assure you it is not. It is dirty and scummy on the outside. The interiors seem ok at first glance, but you can tell that there are major repairs that need to be done. Patched walls and knicked doors abound. The elevator takes forever. The carpet is old and musty, I itched just sitting in the room. Also the plumbing in the bathroom was ill fitting and look as if it should not be exposed. I am so disappointed, but grateful it was only one night.
reviews.title: Exelent rate price/quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting in to a town after 10 pm in a different time zone is never fun. Thankfully, our hotel was close and it was a good one. This TownePlace Suites is in a business section of town, but it has the look of a suburb. We didn't stay long enough to find out, but I would hope there's a market nearby, because their kitchenettes were clean and well maintained. We would have used them if we'd stayed longer.
reviews.title: Great Miniature Suite

reviews.text: In general, this is an older hotel that has either been very well taken care of, or has been recently remodeled.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not your usual hotel. These rooms are like little apartments. You actually have WALLS! You have DOORS! We had a two bedroom suite. It had two small bedrooms with walls and doors, plus a living room and apartment sized kitchen.
reviews.title: Really wonderfull.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was also quiet, very quiet. I assume that this was because many of the suites are taken by long-term residents. We met people who were just moving to the triangle, and one person was there job hunting.
reviews.title: Football weekend in Chapel Hill

reviews.text: It's surprisingly quiet given that the airport is nearby, but the flight paths don't go over the hotel, so in three days we didn't hear a single plane. Perhaps the interior walls in the suites helped to quiet everything.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Quiet Hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is typical continental breakfast, cereal, yogurt, and sweets, plus hard boiled eggs for protein. The breakfast area is small, but we didn't see that many people there at 5:50am, so we were fine.
reviews.title: Musty and worndown place

aka: Towneplace Suites Raleigh Cary/Weston Parkway Hotel
